result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert G Wagner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying Concealed Weapon. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert G Wagner

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert G Wagner in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to carrying concealed weapon under Milwaukee County Ordinance 63.015.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest. Court found the Defendant guilty. Court orders Defendant to pay a forfeiture of $100.00 including costs to be paid by 09-30-2022 or civil judgment for failure to pay.

Defendant Robert G Wagner in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert G Wagner appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defense counsel has received discovery and has not received a DPA offer and requests additional time to review. JusticePoint informed Defesene that defendant may not be a good candiate for DPA due to low risk. Court ordered case adjourned for deferred prosecution agreement hearing in Branch 37. All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Robert G Wagner in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Attorney is new counsel.   Defense counsel to receive discovery and offer.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 043233,
Payable Number: 1004374,
Receipt Number: 22RP018045,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Robert G Wagner in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Defendant to apply additional information to the SPD office and may be seeking his own counsel.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Robert G Wagner in court.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/24/22 @ 2p
